message: I had a $100 Best Buy gift card and bought a pair of Bose IE2 earbuds. They rock, and I'm not generally a Bose fan.
The Bose sound great, but even more impressive is how comfortable they are.
Personally, I have the monster power beats. I like them a whole lot more than the Bose. What it comes down to is whether you like the sound quality. If you like them, then you made a good choice
friends don't let friends buy Bose. you're not my friend, so go ahead ;) seriously, everything depends on your budget, maybe have a look at ultimate ears?
They are definitely comfortable, did you get the new ones with the little hook that holds it inside your ear?
My brother-in-law has some Bose head Phones. The price stinks but the sound quality is great. U put the headphones on and it fills like your front row seat at a concert. Very recommended

I did get the ones with the little hook that holds it inside your ear. Seriously, most comfortable earbuds ever. I'm really not a Bose fan in general. I've got a pair of Ultimate Ears with comply foam tips that are great for noise isolation when mowing the lawn, etc, but I can't wear them for longer than a half an hour without my ears itching. The way the Bose IE2's just sort of set in your ear with that hook is so much more comfortable.
whoa didn't realise ie2 only $90 on amazon... does it comes with iphone remote?
I think there is a version with iPhone remote. More expensive.

Bose makes overpriced shit, don't buy anything from them. For less than $100 the best you could do sound quality wise is probably the Etymotic ER6i or MC5. http://www.amazon.com/Etymotic-Research-Isolator-Earphones-Black/dp/B000BQSGMM and http://www.amazon.com/Etymotic-Research-Noise-Isolating-Earphones/dp/B003S3RFIQ respectively. The Shure SE115 isn't bad either http://www.amazon.com/Shure-SE115-BLU-Isolating-Earphones-Microspeaker/dp/B001TDKML4.

I didnt test Bose but have great experience with Shure. There is one for every budget : http://www.amazon.com/Shure-SE535-V-High-Definition-MicroDriver-Detachable/dp/B003NSBKT6/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1301222537&sr=8-3
It's been my experience that Bose equipment have crappy mids.
